post_text:
Congratulations to our recent graduate, Mia! Mia will be starting college next month majoring in Animal Science while working towards a certificate in animal health. She plans to become a veterinarian technician in the near future. We are so proud of you and your accomplishments, Mia! ‚†Ä‚†Ä
"I couldn't have done it without you and all the other teachers at Audeo...attending Audeo was the best decision I ever made. I was able to stay completely focused and comfortable and I never had a hard time there.‚Äù - Mia, 2020 Graduate from Audeo Charter School
.
.
.
#altusschools #audeocharterschool #highschool #middleschool #charterschool #independentstudy #publicschool

post_text:
Today kicks off National Charter Schools Week 2020‚Äìthe annual celebration of charter schools! Altus Schools exist because we believe KIDS COME FIRST! We strive to meet not only the academic needs of our students but the holistic needs of students‚Äô families and communities. Join us in celebrating #charterschoolsweek! TOGETHER, we are Transforming Lives! .
.
.

shared_text:
Audeo Kids
May 6 at 7:11 PM ¬∑

We are so pleased to introduce you to the newest member of the Audeo Kids Staff, Liz Orona. Please give her a warm welcome!!

‚ÄúHi! My name is Ms. Liz Orona and I am so excited to join the Audeo K-5 family! I have been a teacher for six years and I am entering my third year with Altus Schools. I received my education from The University of Texas at Arlington where I earned my Bachelor's Degree in Elementary Education and my Master‚Äôs Degree in Curriculum and Instruction. Go Mavs!

In addition to being a teacher, I am also a mother and a military spouse. I am so excited to join Audeo Kids on this journey of learning!‚Äù

post_text:
This week is Teacher Appreciation Week! We would like to take the time to express our sincere gratitude to all our Altus teachers who are making a difference in the lives of their students. Our teachers continue to find new and innovative ways to motivate and engage students with distance learning ‚Äîwhile also balancing their role as parents, caregivers, advocates, and more.
‚†Ä‚†Ä
Teachers‚Äî keep up the great work! You are SO appreciated! Let‚Äôs hear it for our TEACHERS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!üëèüëçüôå
.
.
.

post_text:
As we continue to experience the heartfelt affects of COVID19 on our communities and families, our teachers and staff want to remind you that you are not alone! We are constantly looking for ways to better serve our families to ensure every student has the opportunity to be successful at accomplishing their personal and academic goals. Altus Schools exist because we believe KIDS COME FIRST!
.
.
.
If you are a currently enrolled student or parent of an enrolled student, CLICK LINK IN BIO and navigate to our COVID19 resources > Distance Learning to fill out our Family Needs Assessment Survey. We want to know how we can better serve YOU!

post_text:
Virtual meetings to build THE FUTURE. This is how we continue to grow Cadet Corps...ALTUS SCHOOLS style!
.
.
.
@altuscacc is providing educational and engaging sessions for current cadets and interested students through online resources. The @hqcacc motto is "ESSAYONS!" In French it means "Let us try!" At Altus Schools, we want to try to do what we can to help all students succeed!

post_text:
#BoredintheHouse? Certainly not our Audeo Kids!
.
.
.
@AudeoKids are having so much fun during their weekly LIVE group meetings. Recently, STEM activities called for students to rebuild the THREE LITTLE PIGS' houses using objects from around their home. Here is Kaylee testing out the BIG BAD WOLF's huffing and puffing technique with a hairdryer. Her hard work and dedication has paid off...her house made of blocks isn't going anywhere!
.
.
.
@AudeoKids is a FREE homschool program for kids in K-5. Enroll today! #audeokids #homeschool #K5 #stemlearning #stem #stemlearning

post_text:
Student Spot Light: Sweetwater Secondary School senior, SARA!
.
.
.
Congratulations to Sara on her recent acceptance to NYU!
Read more from Sara:
"Altus schools helped me achieve my goals by really giving me the room to grow in and out of the classroom. Without my flexible school schedule I wouldn‚Äôt have been able to pursue acting or take the time to meaningfully apply to universities. I also believe my change from traditional high school to Altus schools and all the positive impacts that move had on my education helped highlight my uniqueness in application essays. At NYU I plan to study at the Global Liberal Studies school and focus on performing arts."
.
.
.
‚†Ä‚†Ä #altusschools #sweetwater #highschool #middleschool #charterschool #independentstudy #publicschool #sandiegoschools #sandiegocountyschools #sandiegounified

post_text: The physical locations of our offices and Resource Centers may be closed BUT our students' academic learning continues! Our teachers and staff are bringing you the support and customer service you need digitally and by telephone. Our main line (858) 679-2020 is being answered Monday - Friday, from 7:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., and we will return calls that go to voicemail as soon as possible! For more information, please visit our COVID-19 pages on www.Atus4u.com. #ENROLLNOW #distancelearning

In perhaps one of the biggest challenges of a lifetime for educators, Altus Schools faculty and staff are rising to the occasion! Our educational model translates to engaging, personalized, and individualized distance learning‚Äîa practice that has been implemented since 1993. Our teachers are specifically trained on student engagement. We are proud to continue in the work before us! THANK YOU, Altus Teachers!#ENROLLNOW #distancelearning
.
.
.

post_text: Our administration is closely monitoring the COVID-19 situation. During this unprecedented time, all students will have the option of online learning and support. Resource Centers and office locations will be closed until further notice to all but essential personnel. However, our main phone line (858) 678-2020 is being answered Monday-Friday, from 7:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., and we will return all calls that go to voicemail as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

We continue to celebrate #schoolchoice here at Altus Schools!
.
.
.
‚†Ä‚†Ä
#schoolchoiceweek is an opportunity to bring a positive national attention to what makes every school unique. Here at Altus Schools, our deeply embedded Vision, Mission, and Values creates THE ALTUS DIFFERENCE. Each and every one of our students and families can expect an individualized and personalized experience combined with a culture where KIDS COME FIRST. Our quality educational setting where rigor and compliance are held to the highest standard are the reasons why students at Altus Schools are FINDING THE FOCUS TO CATCH UP, THE FREEDOM TO ACCELERATE, AND THE SUPPORT TO FINISH STRONG!
.
.
.

post_text:
Every Altus School is dedicated to creating environments in which students are able to accomplish their most important goal‚Äîto learn!
.
.
.
In celebrating National #schoolchoice week, we remember WHY we exist:
Every child deserves an effective, challenging, and motivating education. Because each student has their own unique set of talents, interests, and challenges, a variety of options in education is crucial. School choice ensures that each student can find a learning environment that allows them to be INSPIRED, SUCCESSFUL, and HAPPY!

post_text:
#ICYMI our schools Grossmont Secondary School and Sweetwater Secondary School were recently visited by The State Board of Education for their annual 3-Day site visit. The visit consists of interviews with various stakeholders, including our Leadership Team, Board Of Directors, Teachers, Parents, Special Education, Office Staff, and ELAD Department Members. The SBE Site visit is an opportunity for our Education Programs Consultant to visit our schools in person and determine if we are compliant in all areas. CONGRATULATIONS to GSS and SSS! Both schools have received letters of FULL COMPLIANCE from the CDE. üéâ
.
.
.
#altusschools #grossmont #sweetwater #highschool #middleschool #charterschool #independentstudy #publicschool #sandiegoschools #sandiegocountyschools
